website_summaries.verdict: A light bar that comes in a variety of widths for different vehicles and purposes.
pros: Extra-wide design casts more light in front than a pair of standard off road lamps
Comes in sizes ranging from 12" all the way to 52" in width
cons: The lamps lack proper weather sealing and are prone to fog up in humid conditions

customer_reviews.title: Great! Very bright
customer_reviews.text: Great! Very bright! In the first photo - regular head lights. Second photo - high beams. Third - LED with regular beams.
customer_reviews.author: Rion Smith

customer_reviews.title: Flimpsy mounting bracket
customer_reviews.text: Light bar itself is nice sturdy and bright. I just mounted it today on my semi truck. The mounting bracket is another story one of them broke off as I was tightening down the bolts that hold the light in place. I’m hoping that it won’t completely brake off as I’m rolling down the highway. Only reason why I’m not returning it , is because I had already drilled a hole on my bumper. Only reason why I’m giving it one star is because the light itself seems nice let’s see how long it holds.
customer_reviews.author: Edgar G.

customer_reviews.title: NOT WATER RESISTANT
customer_reviews.text: I liked the price and I thought I liked the light bar until we got a little rain now the inside of the lens is covered in moisture waste of time and money.. I wouldn't recommend to anyone using them for outside install
customer_reviews.author: Coffee Junkie

customer_reviews.title: Doesnt get better than this for $20
customer_reviews.text: Doesnt get better than this for $20. I put this on my son's Polaris 110 Sportsman so others could see him better on the trails being such a small ATV. The light itself is blinding. I added these Green plastic covers (6" each) and its perfect for day or night time use without blinding the oncoming riders. Here is the link to the plastic covers
customer_reviews.author: Anthony B.

customer_reviews.title: Nilight LED Light Bar 12 Inch 72W
customer_reviews.text: The light has two mounts with 4 threaded holes in them. All 4 holes in one of the mounts are not threaded all the way. The bolts will only screw in a fraction of the way making it impossible to mount the light. Poor quality control, Chinese Junk!
customer_reviews.author: Randy225

customer_reviews.title: Got everything wired up fine and the light mounted
customer_reviews.text: Got everything wired up fine and the light mounted. Kept blowing fuses. Put a 30amp fuse in and it didn’t blow that but wires for really hot and the light never turned on.
customer_reviews.author: Isaac Vaughn

customer_reviews.title: Check the lenses
customer_reviews.text: Ok first off, I’m a fan of nilight products. I have them on my Jeep and my 4 wheeler and all have been awesome. However, this particular light is not built like it should be. The LED diodes are off centered in the middle 6 spot lenses, which throws the beam to the left. This light has 2 mounting brackets which suggests that there should be little to no adjustment left to right. Yes it is bright, and the fog lenses aren’t as bad off as the center, but it’s still not like it should be.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Pannell

customer_reviews.title: Nice look, short life
customer_reviews.text: I would expect it to last longer. Mounted on my JD1025R. Unit is stored indoors so anticipated it to last at least a few years. Turned them on the other day and they are only outputting half the light they use too and flashing. Checked for voltage issues and have a constant 12v at the harness into the lighting bar. Very displeased. I have a second one in the box I was going to use for the back up light, hopefully it lasts since it will be replacing the forward facing one now.
customer_reviews.author: Beverly A. Scagliarini

customer_reviews.title: Assembly is tricky
customer_reviews.text: It came nicely packaged, however some assembly is required. Caution: The sheet metal does not necessarily match the bolt holes correctly, thee is some misalignment, hence the cautionary steps listed. Allow about an hour for assembly. That's why the 3 stars. 1) Take your time and manually feed the adjustment bolts manually BEFORE you attach the adjustment/mounting bracket. 2) Once you have done hat, remove them BUT remember which one went where, otherwise you'll have to do it over again. Puts out a very bright light.
customer_reviews.author: Wheelgunner

customer_reviews.title: Went dead after couple hrs of use.
customer_reviews.text: Went dead after couple hours of use, Bought 2, have one to neighbor for a birthday gift.. bought Nilight harness also for it. Just went out for no reason, didnt notice any moisture in it. So to wait on Nilights warranty.. (3-31-19 few questions from Nilight and they sent out a new one to my friend... used it rest of the winter for plowing) I'll review more later after warranty has been complete.
customer_reviews.author: Angora

customer_reviews.title: Reasonable quality and light output for the price
customer_reviews.text: Two bolts on the first light would not screw into the mounting bracket. Amazon sent a replacement in two days. Adjusting and tightening the vertical bracket bolts can require small fingers to reach. Took me an hour to get them installed and tightened. Seems like a solidly constructed unit but I put silicone on every joint/opening as I have learned to do with every light from China. Lights seem bright so far (only been two days) but also seems that has high vertical light pattern that isn't necessary. Will try to adjust light a little but don't think it will help much. For $19 can't expect the same output or quality of lights costing 5 times as much.
customer_reviews.author: MDT

customer_reviews.title: Great After 30-45 Minute Install
customer_reviews.text: This Lightbar is amazing on my Yamaha. It was easy to hook up to the battery. The mounting aspect was a bit more tricky and involved using some tape to hold in my exact placement. The light itself is brighter than my headlights on the Yamaha Raptor. I also love the placement as it shines bright and is easy to turn on or off. It makes for a great light in case you are on a farm or looking to see a particular road. I also went through mud and the light bar experienced no water damage. This is a great buy. Installation should take about 30-45 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremiah Brosowske

customer_reviews.title: Day Time
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these side by side on top of my Security Patrol Van and they light up the area like its day time. Wow! Makes doing nightly rounds safer and more visible. I love them. I also added a third one for when I'm in reverse. I can back up now with my back up camera and I'm secure on not hitting anything. Buy this light. Buy a wire harness with a relay to install this light. My relay came with a switch and two lights can be installed to the harness. Its on Amazon too.
customer_reviews.author: Maggies Review

customer_reviews.title: LED Light bar
customer_reviews.text: This little guy is super bright. I mounted it center on the front of my bumper. Very good wiring diagram. I bought this because my headlight covers are getting 'Foggy'. I've tried and tried many times with different techniques and chemicals to no avail. I run with my brights on and doesn't seem to bother anyone. But running with this LED Light Bar, I definitely get the 'FAST FLASH' from oncoming traffic. I just bought one more with plans to move them to the outside of my front bumper. Killer lights. I'm even thinking putting one on my back bumper. SUPER reverse light.
customer_reviews.author: DnASoup

customer_reviews.title: Super bright, works great on my mower.
customer_reviews.text: One of my headlights went out on my little rider mower. This was cheaper than a headlight replacement. I cut off the quick connectors and used wire nuts to connect it directly to the wires from the old headlight. Mounting was a little goofy because of the irregular grill on the mower, but I just used zip ties. Wish I would've done this sooner, although now my neighbors can hear AND SEE me when I'm mowing after dark.
customer_reviews.author: skipper mcskipperson

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This light bar is absolutely fantastic! It's looks awesome and feels indestructible! You can't beat the price of $20 it comes with everything you need to install it and if it doesn't fit whatever your mounting it on don't afraid to drill a hole. In my opinion I don't see how you could be disappointed. Keep in mind it's only 12" so if you're really looking to light up the trail buy a longer one. This 12" light with my high beams suits me just fine. Good luck
customer_reviews.author: Gen

customer_reviews.title: Very bright
customer_reviews.text: Very bright. I originally bought this for my atv. But I'm getting where I cant see the road that good at night driving home from the hunting club. So I put it on my bumper of my 2005 f250. It's just what I needed. Lights the road perfectly. I highly recommend it and it's at a great price.
customer_reviews.author: james hughes

customer_reviews.title: Received cheap "Jerry-built" mount bracket!
customer_reviews.text: Received cheap "Jerry-built" mount bracket and not the ones advertised. Disappointing. I reordered a replacement, lets see what I get. Disappointing. UPDATE: Received a replacement and again with the "Jerry-Built" brackets. RETURNING. Look for a reliable seller. UPDATE2 Contacted seller and they sent me the correctly advertised brackets free of charge.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Turns night into daylight .  very bright
customer_reviews.text: The mounting system is Very Good & sturdy. Especially like the fact that base mount is fully adjustable for width. Others require a set end mount. These allow good adjustments for mounting bolts. Very bight & doesn't blow fuses. Wired directly into Polaris Ranger headlight circuit and comes ON with the factory lights. Has a slight bluish tint, but nothing objectionable. Broad spread of light. Had to tilt up a bit to get full benefit of field of view. So far - very happy with product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So far I'm impressed for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I recently received this light to install on a quick release for use on the bow of my boat. I am using a cigarette lighter adapter for power, with a wireless receiver to remotely turn it on and off when navigating. I wired the light to the wireless receiver box, then wired the cigarette lighter adapter to the other end of the wireless receiver. Plugged it in, and was instantly blinded because I was a dumb A$$ and was looking in to it as I plugged it in. This thing is bright! The spot light portion of the bar reaches out there, while the flood portion really spreads the light. Now time will tell to see if it holds up.
customer_reviews.author: B. Mayeux

customer_reviews.title: Easy install - Club Car Precedent
customer_reviews.text: Installed this on a Club Car Precedent - plenty of light. Because of the tilting mount, I was able to angle it down slightly so that it does not shine directly into others. I installed it along with the following items:
customer_reviews.author: BLITZN99

customer_reviews.title: Great Light Bar
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good...I got the light installed in a couple of hours (due to not having instructions with the wiring harness) and it looks great on the front of my Polaris! I checked it out last night and this thing is super bright! Should do well for me in the country. There was even an extra spot on my ATV to mount the switch so it almost looks like it belongs there. Will report back after sustained usage.
customer_reviews.author: Jason N.

customer_reviews.title: Great light & lite on the wallet.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this light for use on my...snowblower. Yes, seriously. Most come with a headlight but they don't do much. They're always mounted too low to do any good. So I mounted this light up high on the top of my cab and it works great! A great light especially for the money. Really good field of light, heaviest toward the middle which I like. The only thing that's a little flimsy is the mounting brackets. They are very adjustable and that's great but they could benefit from a little thicker material there. But again, for the price they can't be beat!
customer_reviews.author: KCF.

customer_reviews.title: Very bright lights.
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these for the front of my duck hunting boat. I bought them along with 4 four inch fog lights. I wasn't sure if the smaller ones were going on the sides or in front. After testing both, the larger ones were definitely going up front. The combination of fog lights and spot lights will work perfectly for finding my way on the water in the dark. These lights are extremely bright. They were packaged very securely and arrived on time. I read a lot of reviews before buying them and I'm very pleased with my purchase. Definitely worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: JTB

customer_reviews.title: My husband LOVED it!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband and he loves it! I did by the wiring harness and brackets to go with it as it is an older 4-wheeler and wanted to make sure he had all he needed. He said it lights up the whole mountain. Now I do not worry about him trying to see after dark to get home. A definite must for anyone riding in the woods at night!
customer_reviews.author: KoalaCris

customer_reviews.title: Great light for zero turn mower
customer_reviews.text: In my case, I use this on my zero turn mower. For this application it's plenty bright. To me it seems it would be a little light on brightness for a vehicle off-roading. I fabricated a bracket for my Husqvarna MZ52 and mounted to the mower deck mounts. This work perfectly and provides plenty of light for mowing in the dark if need be. It was easily tied into the switch of the mower using the included 12-volt relay. Complete kit ready to go!
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: The light is even brighter and lights up the area behind the trailer better than I could have imagined
customer_reviews.text: I am using the light as a back-up light for a 28 foot enclosed trailer. I mounted the light above the rear door in the center of the trailer. The light is even brighter and lights up the area behind the trailer better than I could have imagined. Great value for the money. As I just connected it yesterday I'll comment later on the longevity of the product. At the moment I have nothing but praise for the product.
customer_reviews.author: Lchampion

customer_reviews.title: Mounting Hardware not good
customer_reviews.text: Hello, I've purchased this light and I believe it's a good product for the price. What have amaze me is that they advertise a better mounting hardware than other LED lights and I've received with my order EXACTLY the "bad" hardware that they advertise with the light. Problem with the Allen bolts and the mount is that it doesn't let you angle the light high (or low) enough where you need it. Couldn't find a contact information for the seller and I already installed so do not want to uninstall to send back but just be aware the mounting hardware is not like the one described.
customer_reviews.author: Andres Illarramendi

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I had what "looked " like the same light bar on a used ATV I bought that works awesome at night. I bought this one for ATV #2 that I bought used. Nowhere near as bright and very poor distance illumination. My stock Arctic Cat headlamp brights have better distance out of a stock #881 bulb. Either something is wrong with this light bar or it is of a poor quality. Of course it is now installed and "used" so probably cannot return. Maybe I can install on my lawn tractor and look cool...Lol
customer_reviews.author: Maria Ziemba

customer_reviews.title: Bright light
customer_reviews.text: Easy install onto the front bumper assembly. Wired to a 12vdc power source through a 12vdc relay so light bar would only have power when the ignition key was turned on. Didn't want to drain the battery accidentally. Light is bright. People notice you coming down the roadway!!!
customer_reviews.author: John Sachs

customer_reviews.title: 12" Spot/Flood light bar
customer_reviews.text: Ordered the 12" spot and flood light bar. Installed on the front of my 2004 Polaris Sportsman. Wired into the high beam switch, so no additional parts needed other than a bit of wire and connections. So far very please with the brightest, and throw of beam. I believe it will work extremely well on the trail. Only complaint is the mounts can only be installed in a mostly downward/upward angle. Would be nice to have been able to install it straight on but the brackets wouldn't allow that and have the light face forward, although the downward/upward mounting does cover most applications.
customer_reviews.author: john

customer_reviews.title: Great lights!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love the lights, but I would recommend using blue loctite on installation. The bolts backed out on mine and broke a bracket. Waiting for a response from customer service now. I just emailed them. Other than that, it is a great product. I have had them on my truck for a little over a year now.
customer_reviews.author: Kent

customer_reviews.title: Very bright
customer_reviews.text: I bought a pair of 12" lights. At installation, one worked great and lit the cockpit of my boat like daylight. The other wouldn't turn on. I called the seller and they promptly sent me another which worked great. All the screws are stainless steel and the lights are really made for a tough environment. If you need a lot of light for a bargain price, there are a good choice.
customer_reviews.author: onetermandout

customer_reviews.title: Great bang for your buck!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a LED light bar to put on my bass boat. I came across this particular product because of it's rating and amount of reviews left. Very high product quality for the money, I look forward to seeing how well they hold up over time. Install was fairly simple but it was hard to get a couple of bolts in the side of the slide mounts. Will definitely be looking at this manufacturer for future products!
customer_reviews.author: Brandon White

customer_reviews.title: Sadly couldn't rough it.
customer_reviews.text: Installation: Save yourself any surprises and use locktight. Brightness: Good for the price point. Durability/longevity: Failed after a month of light/intermittent use. Recommend to others: Negative; it failing ruined that.
customer_reviews.author: Mike H

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Works like a charm. Mounted mine to my yamaha G19 golfcart. Perfect amount of light, very bright, and crisp white. Lights up the road and woods very well. This replaced a couole of cheapo halogens from harbor freight that I had previously mounted (nothing wrong with those either, in fact they were still working great after about 3yrs - but this light bar id FAR superior).
customer_reviews.author: JUTSFL

customer_reviews.title: Very bright for the wattage
customer_reviews.text: I would say a good buy as well. Can't address how water resistant it is, but I can tell you I hated the mounting system. I ended up making my own with 1" x 1/8" aluminum bar. Bolted the bar to the light (had to change out the odd metric nuts to SAE) and screwed the bar the the trailer. I bet the original bracketry would rust apart, mach schnell. But for a ramp door flood light it kicks butt.
customer_reviews.author: ItsAllAboutTime

customer_reviews.title: great value ,  great quality
customer_reviews.text: outstanding . 72 watts divided by your 13.5 volts when charging = 5.3 amp draw. I put 2 of these on a Kawasaki mule and it is spectacularly bright. well made, look at their video online. Nilight takes one of these and smashes it, etc etc and it keeps working. to protect finish, I applied outdoor clear coat spray paint to everything but the lens
customer_reviews.author: Paul P.

customer_reviews.title: Great light for zero turns
customer_reviews.text: Bought this light for my husband for Christmas for his bad boy zero turn mower. It looks like it came from the factory with this light on it. Super bright and made the neighbors envy and eager to buy. We did add a switch we purchased from Orileys and wired it that way. Easy setup and perfect for our zero turn.
customer_reviews.author: Danni1226

customer_reviews.title: Gives the lighting I needed
customer_reviews.text: Great looking works great . For we can work at night in the garden and mow the yard also before a large rain storm comes in.Most charging systems can keep up with the light perfectly 😉.
customer_reviews.author: BrotherRidge

customer_reviews.title: Great light bar!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a sleek, low profile looking light bar installation on my Honda Pioneer. This light bar was the trick. I used some old metal I had laying around and made a bracket to install it in the opening of the front bumper. I think it looks great and the light output is awesome! I've had it for about a year now and it's held up great to every condition I've thrown at it.
customer_reviews.author: BAS2k3

customer_reviews.title: Great for ATV
customer_reviews.text: Very bright and appropriate for off-road use only. I use it on an ATV. Casts a lot of light in a large area. Makes it easy to see as I ride trails at night. Do not buy this for you truck or SUV for on road use. Way too much glare for oncoming drivers and not safe.
customer_reviews.author: Smithlord

customer_reviews.title: works, cheap, wouldn't bet on it being waterproof.
customer_reviews.text: used one of these, and later 2 as headlights on my crappy 24 hours of lemons / lucky dog racing league race car. worked well... but since I don't have hundreds of hours on it, and have never gotten it wet I can't speak to it's durability.
customer_reviews.author: dustin leavitt

customer_reviews.title: Hardware is super soft. Aluminum housing is very delicate
customer_reviews.text: The light output sucks. Walmart lightbar was 60% brighter. My biggest issue was the mounting system. One bump on a trail and they all came flying off. The aluminum it mounts onto is so soft and easily gets bent. For those who won't see any sort of bump on the road. It should be fine. But the design on mounting is garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Frankie

customer_reviews.title: Great upgrade light bar
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and brighter than expected!! I wired this bar into the high beam circuit to keep from adding another switch. The consumption for this light bar is 6A (doing the math) and the stock lamps only pull 10. The relay is rated at 30A and fused at 20A. Don't do a lot of night riding but when I do, this light bar will be most useful. Can't wait to try it out now the time change is coming soon!
customer_reviews.author: Dawn Brosie

customer_reviews.title: Nice bright light
customer_reviews.text: Nice bright light, wired it directly into the high beam side of my grizzly 660 center mounted. Mounting hardware is JUNK Thus the 4 stars... Specifically, the mounting blocks on both sides were stripped right out of the box.. Took 1/4 turn to tighten and they stripped right out. Cheap aluminum threads... Luckily I am mechanically inclined. I just pulled them off, drill pressed the blocks and replaced the bolts with my own smaller nuts and bolts... Other than that I have about 30 hours on the light with no issues......
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Smith

customer_reviews.title: Lighting up the world!
customer_reviews.text: Have two of these mounted off the back of my ROPS on my Kubota BX and love them! Pulls between 6 and 7 amps with the two of them and light up amazingly! Have a 22" mounted off the front of the ROPS and together they even seem to light up the sides even! Now if Kubota would have left a good place for switches!!! No worries, 3D printer working on that!
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Awesome light that replaced the old lights on my old 36-inch John Deere riding mower!
customer_reviews.text: This LED light shines a very white. bright and wide beam of light! I put it on my old John Deere riding mower to replace the not so bright originsl headlights. Holy Cow! What a magnificent difference!
customer_reviews.author: George B.

customer_reviews.title: It's blinding quality
customer_reviews.text: This light is crazy bright ! High quality too . You would think this would be junk but holy crap to my surprise it is amazing heavy duty insanely brite . Im going to get another one or 2 for my side by side . I mounted this on my club car golf cart ..so happy I go this .
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Great light for the price.
customer_reviews.text: For the price it's a good auxiliary light. The beam pattern isn't great. I was hoping for a good combination of driving light and fog light pattern but it's more of a diffused circle of light. The plastic lens is thin and held against the gasket by screws. I can see the as a failure point but it does look easy to replace if it gets broken.
customer_reviews.author: InvertedBlue

customer_reviews.title: Good light but not very bright.
customer_reviews.text: Good little light. Not as bright as I was wanting. Only a little brighter than my headlight on my ‘19 Honda Rancher. I ordered a 20” to replace it hoping for more light. I’ll mount this on something else eventually.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Judy

customer_reviews.title: Great light for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Great light for the price! A few little imperfections here and there, but hey, it was $20. What do you expect. This light surpassed my expectations. It is well constructed, installed in just 30 minutes (most of which was for running wires), and is wat brighter than I expected. I'd recommend it to anyone and would buy again. Took one star off due to lack of a relay/switch kit and a few "made in China" imperfections. Buy with confidence.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Tillotson

customer_reviews.title: Lights suddenly quit working.
customer_reviews.text: Installed light on ATV. Turned switch on and off. Tested several times and light worked perfectly. Three days later preparing to ride, hit switch lights came on then went out. Lights just inexplicably stopped working. Tried everything except taking light apart and looking inside. Even hooked directly to battery.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Pay more money for better lights
customer_reviews.text: These lights are “you get what you pay for” They are considerably bright and work well. However- mounting isn’t the best and the life of them is very short. I had mine for only 6 months before they died. Maybe used for a total of 10 hours a month or so. Now they just flicker.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Installed it on a Smitybilt bracket and used a Nilight wiring kit. Easy install, plenty bright from a budget led bar. No complaints for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Samuel

customer_reviews.title: Bright
customer_reviews.text: Very bright and seems to be well built. Make sure you take note of the mounting width as I didn't and this one turned out to be too narrow to fit in the holes on my bull bar. I gave this one away and bought two smaller ones.
customer_reviews.author: J. R. O. Neal

customer_reviews.title: Beware
customer_reviews.text: The light bar is very bright, however either the small mounting bolts are to long or the mount holes weren't threaded the entire way. Screwed them in till they stopped and it wasn't close to being tight. Tried removing them and 2 broke off in the mount. Very disappointing
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Bad hardware
customer_reviews.text: Haven’t been able to test as hardware in poor shape. Mounting nut improperly threaded and washer deformed. Gonna have to make a trip to hardware store.
customer_reviews.author: mf121

customer_reviews.title: Bright as Heck!
customer_reviews.text: Super bright! I will admit, I was not prepared for this light to work as well as they do! I bough two and installed to the bumper of my 1500 - who needs a light bar when you have two of these! I did read the review and took an extra moment to silicon seal where the power cord enters the housing - I HAVE HAD NO LEAKING OR FOGGING - and I hunt through every kind of weather condition!
customer_reviews.author: MisterHunter

customer_reviews.title: High quality
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my son's Fourwheeler, didn't expect much for $19.99 but it was the right size and I thought why not? It's very bright, and seems very high quality. Very happy, I will be buying another for my garden tractor for seeing this winter blowing snow.
customer_reviews.author: carguy

customer_reviews.title: This little light is way more than I expected for ...
customer_reviews.text: This little light is way more than I expected for under 35.00.....I would buy it again in a heartbeat. Granted I cannot speak for it as far as how it holds up over the long haul since I haven't had it long enough yet. But I can say the build quality is very nice and it comes with a 2 year warranty.
customer_reviews.author: SnKWNC

customer_reviews.title: Customer service
customer_reviews.text: I put this light on my 4 wheeler it looks great and is brighter then other ones i had . Great price . Great customer service and ill be looking at one for a gift for my son .. this will make snow plowing and trail rideing much brighter.
customer_reviews.author: Allan Emter

customer_reviews.title: Take the time to seal them
customer_reviews.text: Great light for the price, but to ensure longevity, take the 5 minutes to take the end caps off and silicone the ends and take out all the little screws on the front of light and silicone them then run a bead around the lens. Use clear and take your time and it will look "factory" and will make a $20 light last a long time
customer_reviews.author: in thought

customer_reviews.title: Totally wired
customer_reviews.text: I like everything about these lights except the wiring....they should come with the ends already installed so that your wiring harness is truly a plug and play....love the lights...love the wiring harness/toggle switch combo I bought separately to wire 2 lights ....factory install the electrical ends on the light wires !! Not a big deal to do it but unnecessary
customer_reviews.author: Andrew B

customer_reviews.title: Bright lights. But holes on one bracket mount drilled to big and not tapped
customer_reviews.text: Bought five of the 12in light bars for a small bowfishing boat. I get to the last light bar and the mounting holes for one of the brackets where never tapped. The bolts just fallen in. Seems like the hole is drilled to big so can’t be retapped. Kinda upset, got all the way to the last one and only able to secure one bracket. Going to try and contact the company and see what they can do for me
customer_reviews.author: Monihepps

customer_reviews.title: Cheap hardware
customer_reviews.text: The light itself appears to be ok so far. The hardware is junk. The bolts to mount the light bar to the bracket were to long, you cant tighten it. The mounting block has aluminum threads and it will strip out easily.
customer_reviews.author: Zach

customer_reviews.title: Bright and no problems with it
customer_reviews.text: I put this on my side X side last summer and it has sat out side in all kinds of weather so far no problems. I used it daily driving out of the woods in hunting season and this is like turning on the sun
customer_reviews.author: Dale Smith

customer_reviews.title: Bright light, mounts could be better.
customer_reviews.text: Like the title says, the mounts are kind of tough, very small area to get the screws into. It also makes angle adjustment after install a pain. I mounted this on my club car precedent about 2 months ago, no issues so far. Hopefully it holds up well.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME BRIGHT LED LIGHT
customer_reviews.text: AWESOME LED light. Easy to install with the suggested wiring harness. Mounting brackets are easy to install. Mounted this on the front of my golf cart and boy what a difference it makes. SUPER BRIGHT. Well worth the money
customer_reviews.author: Darick Deel

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I needed to add a light to my 360 John Deere lawn mower. JD wanted $249.00 for their light system i wasnt going to pay that. This was easy to install since I had a switch and all te wires I needed. It is very bright, love it.
customer_reviews.author: Moses Ramos

customer_reviews.title: Works good for me
customer_reviews.text: Got it mounted on my 02 silverado for use on the back roads to help see deer. It's been working great so far and is bright.
customer_reviews.author: John J

customer_reviews.title: Only runs at 26.4 watts
customer_reviews.text: I have had this light for a while but only recently checked to see how many watts it draws. It draws 2.2 amps at 12 volts which is 26.4 watts- 1/3 the stated output in the description. However, the light is bright enough for my purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Towhee

customer_reviews.title: It's okay ish
customer_reviews.text: I needed a light bar with a universal style mount, this one hasn't moved at all so I will give it that but the light output isn't any brighter then my headlights themselves.
customer_reviews.author: 907diesel

customer_reviews.title: Great light, great price
customer_reviews.text: Great light, bright, fits great between push bars on various 4 wheelers. Took a lot of beating and banging for a couple months, no complaints so far.
customer_reviews.author: MC Tires n Service

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't come with the swivel brackets
customer_reviews.text: Ordered a light from here before, and it was a great light. But, this order didn't come with the swivel brackets that allow you to move the light up or down, and one LED bulb is blown on it. If it wasn't for those two issues, it would've got five stars.
customer_reviews.author: Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Very cost-effective light
customer_reviews.text: Bought this light to replace headlights on a older club car golf cart. You’ll have to aim them quite a bit to the ground because they are bright!
customer_reviews.author: David L.

customer_reviews.title: Great patio light for my Van
customer_reviews.text: I mounted the 12 inch light bar onto my van roof rack to use as a patio light. It works great so far. The light draws just a bit over 2 amps, so it's not too bad using it on my AGM battery.
customer_reviews.author: DLH

customer_reviews.title: Mounted on my John Deere 3120 midsize.  Great!
customer_reviews.text: I needed more light in the back when winter blading of snow. I mounted this unit on the ROPS to shine backward when folded down. When folded up it will light forward. Very easy to install and works like a charm. Everything was included to hookup and mount this led light bar.
customer_reviews.author: Gatlin

customer_reviews.title: not as bright as i hoped
customer_reviews.text: used one the front of my boat for night cruising in the ocean. not as bright as i had hoped
customer_reviews.author: Pat John

customer_reviews.title: Great light output!
customer_reviews.text: Not using on a vehicle so I don't know how they will handle vibration. I'm using them to light up outside my home and they are working fine in a stationary installation. Only use them to light up for security cameras and if I need to do something outside. As to durability, Time will only tell.
customer_reviews.author: star

customer_reviews.title: Super bright LEDs
customer_reviews.text: Just installed on my 4 wheeler today, super bright and just what I wanted. The spot beam throws light quite a distance. If anything changes I will update.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Bates

customer_reviews.title: Not so great
customer_reviews.text: Very dim lighting. I put it on a 4 wheeler with a 12 volt system and it's effective lighting range is less than a foot! Fully charged battery and 13.2 volts going into the light bar.
customer_reviews.author: elismom610

customer_reviews.title: Awesome super bright
customer_reviews.text: If you're thinking about getting one just go for it. This light bar is a great bang for your buck. Super bright and easy to install. Just keep in mind it does not come with a switch to turn it on and off. Otherwise it's awesome.
customer_reviews.author: The Adams

customer_reviews.title: Here comes the sun
customer_reviews.text: Came on time as promised. Nice light for the price. Bright as the sun. I mounted it to my front rack of my ATV. Didn't come with a relay or fuse block so I put one with it. In going to get a smaller Six inch for my lawn tractor and kids ATV next. I'm happy with this product. Get one for the price. Heck get two of them.
customer_reviews.author: Me myself and I mazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Takes a beating! Still going strong!
customer_reviews.text: I am really impressed with his light bar. I installed in on the roll cage on a Crawler/bulldozer that shakes the snot out of it when it drives. I though this would destroy in right away but it is still going strong! Definitely well made!
customer_reviews.author: JClendenin

customer_reviews.title: Not sure just yet....
customer_reviews.text: Got the item today. Box had previously been opened and light stuffed back in. Looks like it was a return based on the scratch marks on the frame and glass. I read in the reviews that it leaks sometimes. It's no wonder as there are obvious gaps in between the frame housing and the glass! I'll update my review once I get it hooked up and see if it actually works.
customer_reviews.author: Mike D

customer_reviews.title: Great 2way light
customer_reviews.text: Have these mounted on my aftermarket bumper at 30 degree angle from center. These have a great reach and brightness. Recommend these!
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Llanes

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: The 12” is an excellent light for the price. Using for my tractor because the factory lights are blocked by the bucket. Good mix of spot and flood for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Eric F

customer_reviews.title: Still going strong
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this light few years back and mounted it on my atv, this light is still going strong considering what my machine has been through.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Nice light
customer_reviews.text: Very nice, well built, bright light. The mounting bracket however could be better built more rigid.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick F.

customer_reviews.title: Seems to work...
customer_reviews.text: I have installed this on the back of my ATV for plowing at night. Haven't had a chance to use it yet but seems to be very bright in the garage with the lights out. Also ordered the wiring harness which made install fairly easy. Less than an hour.
customer_reviews.author: PolVulter

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic product, it came with the hardware as shown
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic product, it came with the hardware as shown, and worked. I may seem like is working should be a given but recently returned a similar light from another company that was defective. Many company's have this exact style but the quality control was on point. I installed this on my Triumph Thunderbird Storm. Now the bike looks more like the owner 😐.
customer_reviews.author: rokapotomu

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and intense light.
customer_reviews.text: I was completely amazed with how much light comes from this! I put this and two other 4" lights on my 2015 Arctic Mud Pro. I don't even need the OEM lights now. In fact, I can't even notice if the stock lights are on when these are lit up. Great quality and fitment. I recommend that the clamping light mounts be used that Amazon sells.
customer_reviews.author: Daryl Hastings

customer_reviews.title: Honest opinion
customer_reviews.text: The mount is probably one of the worst thought out things to be put into production, other then that the light is durable An very bright. For the price it’s well worth it.... the mount I’d toss in the trash build your own can easily be done.
customer_reviews.author: Ned ford

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for garden tractor
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my Troybilt riding mower / garden tractor. The original headlights for garden tractors are about useless, which is why I bought this light bar. I wish i'd have bought this years ago. Super easy to install and it really lights up the night. Just cut the wires feeding your current useless headlights and spice it into this light bar, twist on some wire nuts and you're set. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Glen Brushart

customer_reviews.title: light
customer_reviews.text: works great on tractor went up to fix son drive way . Tree covered could see light was on in day time
customer_reviews.author: wing

customer_reviews.title: ... on the back of my Honda Pioneer and I love these lights
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two and installed one on the front and one on the back of my Honda Pioneer and I love these lights. Theyre plenty bright and the range is surprising for such a cheap light. So far water doesn't seem to be a problem, ive never submerged them but rain and water form a hose doesn't seem to hurt them one bit. They seem to be of solid made materials and are easy to install. Theyre a little thicker than I would have thought but for where I mounted them its not an issue. Great lights.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda B

customer_reviews.title: Bad hardware design. Decent light.
customer_reviews.text: Mounting hardware is garbage. The nuts in the housing will rotate if you try and tighten the bolts. They wont stay tight since you cant get proper torque even with loc tite and lock washer. Not a bad light for 20 bucks tho.
customer_reviews.author: Mike L.

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Light casing is solid and has excellent illumination. It falls a little short because of the mounting brackets. The threaded holes aren't drilled deep enough to have a tight fit. It has to be fiddled with to work properly.
customer_reviews.author: cynthia varadi

customer_reviews.title: Quality control
customer_reviews.text: This light came well packaged no problem there but the manufacturer of the light didn't take time to inspect the components because one of the mounting brackets was stamped wrong and is inon useable
customer_reviews.author: david h
